intro: Micranthes lepismigena, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Micranthes lepismigena is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert or coastal regions.
